item.title:
RT by @rakitadragan: 1/Let's have a look at how the revm (evm implemented in rust) by @rakitadragan @DaniPopes @mattsse_ and many others uses the Rust builder pattern to create a type-safe and flexible EVM implementation.
First the core builder struct looks like this, where:
- database -> the ethereum state - external_context -> represents stuff like block.number, block.timestamp, tx.origin etc... - handler -> is the component that contains the logic for the EVM execution - phantom -> is a marker type that is used at compile time to make sure different builder methods are called in the right order
item.dc:creator: @letsgetonchain
item.description:
1/Let's have a look at how the revm (evm implemented in rust) by @rakitadragan @DaniPopes @mattsse_ and many others uses the Rust builder pattern to create a type-safe and flexible EVM implementation.

First the core builder struct looks like this, where:

- database -> the ethereum state
- external_context -> represents stuff like block.number, block.timestamp, tx.origin etc...
- handler -> is the component that contains the logic for the EVM execution
- phantom -> is a marker type that is used at compile time to make sure different builder methods are called in the right order
